notes: Or, with the “Long  S’s” left in: “A correfpondent from Columb fays, the following curious fact may be depended on:— John Nichols, of St. Eval, Cornwall, aged about 70 years, the laft 18 of which he has been blind, was about ten days ago, inftantaneousfly reftored to fight in one eye, by being ftung thereon by a bee. His eye fwelled, itched, and was painful ; he rubbed it, and behold a miracle! The blind received his fight.”
We have added one letter to this paragraph’s first sentence, to help twenty-first century eyes. In the original text: “While, I stood looking on the bloody spot with wonder and surprise…”

In 1857, Dred Scott sued for his freedom, and the freedom of his wife and daughters, arguing that he had lived with his master in free states. The Supreme Court found against him, on the grounds that no African-American could claim United States citizenship, and could thus bring no suit to federal court. The ruling was overthrown by the Emancipation Proclamation, and the Constitution’s Thirteenth, Fourteenth, and Fifteenth Amendments.
